fields.name: William Mackie Park
fields.description: This small but well-used park is tucked into a green corner of the Marpole neighbourhood. From the welcoming entry plaza, step down into a shady retreat filled with trees and flowering shrubs; children enjoy both the playground and the central grassy area. (source: City of Vancouver)

fields.name: Marpole Park
fields.description: As marked by a stone cairn in the park, this was the site of a large midden for one of the largest village sites in North America. Today, this small park is a popular place for children to play. Surrounded by trees, the roar of airplanes from the nearby airport in Richmond can be heard above the chatter of happy children. (source: City of Vancouver)
